trans-unit.source: Defines a configuration element for a UDP discovery endpoint.
A UDP discovery endpoint is a standard endpoint that specifies where a discoverable service that uses UDP transport listens for discovery messages and where clients send discovery messages.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Discovery.Configuration.UdpDiscoveryEndpointElement"></xref> class.

When called or overridden by a derived class, creates and initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Discovery.UdpDiscoveryEndpoint"></xref> class that uses the contract description of the current Discovery protocol version and mode.
Not implemented.
A UDP discovery endpoint.
Gets or sets the discovery mode that is used by the discovery endpoint.
Discovery can be performed in two modes, ad-hoc and managed.
In ad-hoc discovery, discovery messages are sent out in a multicast manner to all available services.
In managed discovery, messages are sent in a unicast manner to a discovery proxy.
[!INCLUDE[crabout](~/includes/crabout-md.md)]the discovery modes, see [WCF Discovery Overview](~/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/wcf-discovery-overview.md).
The discovery mode.
When called or overridden by a derived class, gets the type of the UDP discovery endpoint.
The type of the discovery endpoint.
Converts the specified <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint"></xref> into a <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Discovery.UdpDiscoveryEndpoint"></xref>.
The service endpoint object to convert.
Gets or sets the maximum <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> within which all of the ProbeMatches for a service that respond to a probe operation are sent.
The maximum delay.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Discovery.Configuration.UdpDiscoveryEndpointElement.MulticastAddress"></xref> property of a UDP discovery endpoint element.
The multicast address is the IP address from which messages are sent simultaneously to multiple host computers.
An IP address.
When called or overridden by a derived class, converts the specified <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint"></xref> to a UDP discovery endpoint.
The service endpoint to which the configuration settings are applied.
Not implemented.
When called or overridden by a derived class, converts the specified <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint"></xref> to a UDP discovery endpoint.
The service endpoint to which the configuration settings are applied.
Not implemented.
When called or overridden by a derived class, initializes and validates the specified instance of a <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Configuration.ChannelEndpointElement"></xref>.
The channel endpoint element to initialize and validate.
When called or overridden by a derived class, initializes and validates the specified instance of a <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Configuration.ServiceEndpointElement"></xref>.
The service endpoint element to initialize and validate.

When called or overridden by a derived class, gets a collection of the configuration settings contained in the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Discovery.Configuration.UdpDiscoveryEndpointElement"></xref> instance.
A collection of configuration settings.
Gets the binding settings of a UDP transport configuration element.
A UDP configuration element.
